page.title: 03Bradley Church
page.content: The church is called St Mary's and All Saints,the original being wooden.Parts of the present church are Norman the building having been added to over the years.The now blocked main door was at the base of the tower.There is a window in its place.The church is built of sandstone,some of the stone coming from older churches.The south side has battlements at the edge of the roof and the north side a sloping roof.The tower has pinnacles on each corner and a weather cock.The blue clock face is on the south side.A virginia creeper growing on the south wall was planted by Mr Winzer,who was coachman to the Rev.Burton,before the First World War. Outside the church the blocks of stone used as lamp posts were brought from Hollies Quarry at nearby Gnosall.In the churchyard there is the restored base of the 14th century churchyard cross.
